sub_title: ⚡Helping industrial firms reduce energy waste⚡ Benelux | Sensorfact
summary:
👋 Hello! I'm Yamil, a driven Sales Development Representative specializing in the Benelux market at Sensorfact. With a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration and a minor in Entrepreneurship and Big Data Analytics, I'm passionate about finding relationships between Data and Sales.

🎓 I graduated in 2019 with a Full IB Diploma and continued my educational journey to earn my degree in 2023. Bilingual in English and a native Spanish speaker, I'm also enthusiastic about expanding my language skills, currently venturing into Italian. I proudly hold dual nationalities, both Peruvian and Italian, adding a multicultural perspective to my work.

🚀 Beyond my academic journey, I've had the privilege of working in the recruitment industry and co-founding an Events Management Startup. Our startup saw tremendous success, amassing over 1000 recurring 3-month memberships and scaling from 50 to 800 attendees per party in just under six months. Notably, all our parties were consistently sold out, a testament to our team's dedication and growth.

🎧 In my spare time, I pursue my passion for music as a DJ. What started as a hobby has taken me to different corners of the world, playing for audiences of up to 4,000+ people in Peru, Chile, and various cities in the Netherlands (And soon around Europe).

🌍 Making a positive impact on the world is essential to me. I co-founded an NGO called "The Life Project" in Peru, where we raised funds to provide clean water to families in need. I firmly believe that small actions can lead to significant change.

💪 I consider myself an extroverted introvert, driven by a passion for sales and an analytical mindset. My approach is simple: With resilience, a positive attitude, a growth mindset, and the willingness to work hard, there are no limits to what one can achieve.

📈 Let's connect and explore new opportunities; I'm always open to meaningful conversations and connections!

profile_positions.description:
Founded a Nightlife Events Management Startup geared towards international students in the Netherlands.

- Grew party attendance from 50 to 800+ people in less than 6 months

- 1,000+ recurring 3-month membership purchases

- Scaled the DJ team from 0 to 10 quality-checked DJs throughout the Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & Event Organizer

profile_positions.description:
This is a Hobby that takes place on weekends:

Even though I officially began to DJ in 2019, I fell in love with electronic music when I was ten. Since then, I have experimented with different genres of music through mixing, mastering, and music production. Through constant practice, I have taken this hobby to a professional level and now perform at festivals, venues, and private parties in my free time.

- Formed a network with DJs, business owners, and event agencies in the Netherlands, Peru, and several other countries as an International DJ

- Used word of mouth, social media, and electronic word of mouth to secure event bookings

- Performed for audiences ranging from 50 to 4,000 people
profile_positions.title: (Hobby) Disk Jockey

profile_positions.description:
Located in the heart of Amsterdam’s tech hub, Storm5 is the leader in Global Retail Tech Recruitment, connecting organizations with the talent to drive their mission. We are passionate about building Retail Tech and E-Commerce Talent Ecosystems, dedicated to building outstanding and secure online B2B or B2C customer experiences.

We’re able to connect the best talent in Retail Tech by continually networking with both highly skilled professionals and innovative clients.

- Chosen founding member of Storm5 Europe (Fastest growing RetailTech recruitment firm worldwide)

- Company World Record Holder for the fastest interview to occur in all of Levin (Storm5's umbrella company)

- Opened 30+ client accounts via Cold Calling and Email Outreach

- Achieved an Interview per CV sent ratio of 1.6
profile_positions.title: Associate Recruitment Consultant (Senior DevOps & Engineering roles)

profile_positions.description:
I did an Internship at Van Olphen Company: they specialize in international executive search & scouting, coaching, and consultancy.

Clients include industrial, financial, and service companies as well as governmental and non-profit organizations. For more than 30 years, Van Olphen has built long-term partnerships with clients on a foundation of high-quality service, integrity, trust, and a strong focus on results.

- Supported two full-time Executive Search Consultants on sourcing, research, and the creation of company reports

- Conducted in-depth company and industry research to develop company profiles, and determine suitable candidate qualifications

- Used LinkedIn Recruiter Lite, boolean search, and self-developed methods to consistently find and deliver top-quality profiles
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant Intern

profile_positions.description:
I worked at Johnson Industries S.A.C. during my summer vacation. I worked in the warehouse and logistics departments, while constantly traveling to deliver spare car parts throughout the entire city of Lima. Here I sent weekly reports to the CEO on problems and improvements for his company.

- Studied company operations to optimize company processes, delivering weekly reports to the CEO 

- Optimized warehouse loading process to nullify shipping damage entirely

- Taught delivery employees how to use and optimize Waze for better delivery routes
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

profile_positions.description:
I worked in Tecnologia Textil, Peru’s largest textile factory, during my summer vacation. Here, I gained a better understanding of the Peruvian Textile industry, and the intricacies behind producing textiles, while constantly traveling to Gamarra, Peru’s largest textile market.

- Consistently traveled and interacted with company wholesale clients to better understand their needs and how to improve company sales

- Conducted internal company research to improve company processes. Research findings prompted a digitalization initiative within the company
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: The Life Project was created by four friends and myself, under the basis that water is necessary for life. Seeing as shantytowns in Peru need to buy, boil, and sometimes don’t even get water, we raised over 6000 dollars and provided more than 200 families with water filters. This allows them to re-use water for safe consumption.

AIESEC is the world’s largest youth-led organization. It is an international, non profit, UN-affiliated organization that organizes internships and volunteering opportunities in more than 120 countries. All functions in AIESEC were on a voluntary basis.

As the External Relations Manager, I was responsible for maintaining relationships with student associations, educational institutions, and companies when planning external events. I managed a group of certified trainers and sold the concept of AIESEC training workshops to external parties.

- Sold, planned, organized, and managed training workshops with a 100% satisfaction rate among Trainers and External parties.

- Attended networking events on behalf of AIESEC

- Participated in workshops directed by Deloitte, Randstad, and Frazer Jones

- Networked with business owners, educational institutions, and student associations across Noord-Brabant

As an acquisition manager, I was in charge of finding companies and selling the concept of “AIESEC Interns.” The duties of an Acquisition manager are calling, attending networking events, visiting companies, and thinking of new and effective ways to reach companies. This role was strictly online due to the pandemic.

- Researched corporate leads through various methods to sell the concept of “AIESEC Internships.”

- Created selling scripts to teach sales to other AIESEC members

- Attended online networking events on behalf of AIESEC

- Networked with business owners throughout Noord-Brabant

- Worked remotely through a variety of different time zones: Peru, U.S.A., and the Netherlands, while operating under Dutch time
Attended the Warwick Economics Summit representing the delegation of Tilburg University

company.name: Colegio Franklin Delano Roosevelt, The American School of Lima

volunteer_experiences.description: Applied and was successfully chosen to become a Peer Group Connection Leader in my school. PGC leaders undergo special training in order to ensure an easy transition for students coming from Middle School to High School.
